That sounds like a fun day out! I'm happy to help with recommendations, but I need a bit more information from you. Since I'm a large language model, I don't have real-time information about specific locations or businesses. I don't know which children's theater company or location you're referring to.

However, I can offer some general advice on finding kid-friendly Italian restaurants:

1. Online Search: Try searching online for "kid-friendly Italian restaurants near me" or "family-friendly Italian restaurants in [neighborhood/city]". This should give you a list of options to choose from.
2. Check Websites and Menus: Look at the websites of potential restaurants to see if they have a kids' menu or mention being family-friendly. You can also check their menus to ensure they have options that your niece might enjoy.
3. Reviews and Ratings: Read reviews from other parents or families to get an idea of the restaurant's atmosphere and service. Look for ratings or reviews that mention being kid-friendly.
4. Call Ahead: If you're unsure, call the restaurant ahead of time to ask about their kid-friendliness, menu options, and if they have any activities or amenities for kids.

Some popular kid-friendly Italian dishes include:

* Pasta with marinara sauce and meatballs
* Cheese pizza
* Chicken tenders with dipping sauce
* Mac and cheese
* Garlic bread

When you arrive at the restaurant, don't hesitate to ask your server for recommendations or special requests. They're usually happy to accommodate kids' tastes and needs.

I hope this helps, and I'm sure your niece's showcase will be a wonderful experience!
